channel.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge
channel.description:
![BTC%20RAP|497x500](upload://3kVWfBo3Im29MAPjzRDuP9xRBP0.jpeg)
Hey guys it’s @Goxenar, with a special one-off Beat The Clock challenge. I’m dropping some RAP samples for you to incorporate into an Auxy track. This is the first Beat the Clock that involves samples. And no, that's not me in the picture!
<big>**Rules:** </big>
> * Must include one or more of the RAP vocal samples provided below. > * Must be in the key of B and between 120-135bpm tempo. > * Any genre is fine. > * Minor or major key. > * Any Auxy features can be used, including tweaking the sample(s) > * Use any built-in sounds or add other external samples (optional). > * One entry per person. > * Strictly no longer than 60 seconds in length. > * All submissions to be posted in this thread as a SoundCloud link. > * A topic timer at the bottom of this thread shows when submissions close. > * You can change your entry up until the thread closes, by editing your original post. > * Rap samples are only for use in this competition.
Click [HERE](https://app.auxy.co/projects/UkBHMb-ERd1eT5l-4bw4lw==) to download an Auxy project file with key and tempo preset.
<big>**RAP Vocals**</big> > http://auxy.co/samples/vocal1.wav > http://auxy.co/samples/vocal2.wav > http://auxy.co/samples/vocal3.wav
<big>**Downloading Samples**</big> Apple IOS devices don't make it easy to download samples via Safari. You can save the RAP samples to Dropbox or Google Drive and then copy to your Auxy iCloud sample folder from there. Or you can follow these steps: > > 1. Download Puffin Browser (Free) onto your IOS device: https://itunes.apple.com/app/puffin-web-browser-free/id472937654?mt=8 > > 2. Copy one of RAP sample links from above. > > 3. Open Puffin Browser App > > 4. Hold your finger down on the address bar at the top of the Puffin screen and paste in the link. > >5. Click: GO button. > >6. Choose 'Local Storage' > File is now saved to your phone. > >7. Click the 3-lines at the top right of Puffin app (Hamburger icon). > >8. Click the icon showing a downwards putting arrow. > >9. Tap the sample file > >10. Choose "Copy to Auxy" The sample is now saved to your Auxy/Samples folder on iCloud. > > Return to step 2 to do the next sample.
<big>**Using Samples in Auxy**</big> If you haven't used samples in Auxy before: >1. Use the above instructions to put the wav samples on icloud, under: Auxy/Samples >2. Create a new drum instrument in Auxy. >3. Select: Empty kit >4. Click: One of the blank spots on the top >5. Choose: iCloud >6. Pick your sample to load into the drum instrument.
A shortlist of the best entries will appear in the Official Auxy App feed and in this thread, as judged by Goxenar. And there's an Auxy Forum Unicorn up for grabs, for the best overall.
Good luck!

item.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge
item.dc:creator: Hum4n01d
item.description:
Yeah, it was definitely tough to sync things up. I ended up pitching down the first vocal to slow it down and then offsetting it to get it to line up with the beat and then pitching up the second one for the same reason.

item.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Congrats to Xlimator for taking out the top position.

And big ups to those short-listed or receiving honorable mentions!

Actually, thanks to everyone who entered or posted too, as it was fun to have a BTC weekend.

Last, but not least, thanks heaps to Goxenar for providing vocals and hosting / judging this BTC. A lot of us don’t get vocals to play with often, so it was a pretty sweet challenge.

Read full topic

item.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge
item.dc:creator: Goxenar
item.description:
Firstly, I’d like to say that hosting this Beat The Clock was an honor. All of you are so incredibly talented. Of course there’s always room for improvement though. Anyways, without FURTHER-A-DOO.

drum roll

The winner of this Beat The Clock is…

@anon2811266 due to the fantastic use of the samples, tremendously well done “drop” (also known as chorus) and well made outro.

Now as for the shortlist, here are the top 5 (including @anon2811266) entries!

@anon42661524 - His incredibly “chill” and calm approach to the instrumental was definitely top 5 entry material.

@HYDRANS Well what can I say? Those vocals chops were impressive. Period. (The instrumental was also great.)

@FlynnT His “trapstep” approach was magnificent.

@sn.ow.y . - Not a rap beat , but certainly within the challenge guidelines. Fantastic job!

Shortlist link below:
https://soundcloud.com/goxenar/sets/beat-the-clock-rap-challenge/s-Oa7Qy

All entries were truly amazing, great job to you all. Feel free to DM me if there are any questions concerns or comments. Thank you all for the participation, don’t forget about me now. Much love

— Goxenar

Here are some honorable mentions:

@Hum4n01d @Kerfuffle @INDIR3CT @LittleSpikes @Polar

Read full topic

item.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge
item.dc:creator: Kerfuffle
item.description:
The challenge itself is really cool. I have wanted to do a rap piece for a long time since I started my piece, Numb to the Core last year. Being given this challenge brings the creativity back.

I also like the fact we are taking the hosts art as our basis to keep creating. I like hearing other submissions as well like @sn.ow.y up there said, it really shows the different styles people are taking and how they get inspired by a single vocal piece! Each entry I listen to reminds me of elements that would make a complete rap piece.

Read full topic

item.title: BEAT THE CLOCK - RAP Challenge

That’s fantastic to know, I’m happy you seem to be enjoying the challenge. That’s what the community is about. I also enjoy the participation, it’s awesome to see Auxy users come together like this.

Read full topic
